snippet: In the race to succeed Mayor Bloomberg, the campaigns seem to be avoiding any talk of unpleasant budgetary realities.
abstract: Editorial warns the candidates for New York City mayor have avoided discussing city's unpleasant budgetary reality as they make host of unrealistic promises to voters; notes victor will face $2 billion budget deficit and steadily growing health care and pension obligations that will require tough decisions and significant cutbacks.
lead_paragraph: In the race to succeed Mayor Bloomberg, the campaigns seem to be avoiding any talk of unpleasant budgetary realities.

headline.print_headline: The Storm on New York’s Horizon
